Package gw.pl.currency

Class MonetaryAmount

java.lang.Object
gw.pl.currency.MonetaryAmount
All Implemented Interfaces:
IMoney, IDimension<MonetaryAmount,BigDecimal>, ISequenceable<MonetaryAmount,BigDecimal,Currency>, GWRemotable, Comparable<MonetaryAmount>
public final class MonetaryAmount extends Object implements IMoney, GWRemotable, IDimension<MonetaryAmount,BigDecimal>, ISequenceable<MonetaryAmount,BigDecimal,Currency>
Represents a monetary amount with a currency.

  • Constructor Details

    • MonetaryAmount

      public MonetaryAmount()
      Required for SOAP. A MonetaryAmount constructed with this constructor is not valid until both setAmount(java.math.BigDecimal) and setCurrency(Currency) have been called on it. Normal callers should use MonetaryAmount(java.math.BigDecimal, Currency) instead.

    • MonetaryAmount

      public MonetaryAmount(BigDecimal amount, Currency currency)
      Primary constructor
      Parameters:
      amount - Non-null amount.
      currency - The currency of the instance. May not be null

    • MonetaryAmount

      public MonetaryAmount(String value)
      Construct using a string formatted as " " such as "23.25 USD"

    • nextInSequence

      public MonetaryAmount nextInSequence(BigDecimal step, Currency unit)
      Implementation of ISequenceable Returns the next amount in this sequence, given the specified step value. The unit argument passsed in must either be null or match the currency of this amount.

    • add

      public MonetaryAmount add(MonetaryAmount amount)
      Add amount.getAmount() to this.getAmount()
      Returns:
      A MonetaryAmount where getAmount() == this.getAmount().add(amount.getAmount()) and getCurrency() == this.getCurrency()

    • add

      public MonetaryAmount add(MonetaryAmount amount, MathContext mc)
      Add amount to this
      Returns:
      A MonetaryAmount where getAmount() == this.getAmount().add(amount.getAmount(), mc) and getCurrency() == this.getCurrency()

    • divide

      public MonetaryAmount divide(BigDecimal amount)
      Divide this by the given BigDecimal.
      Returns:
      A MonetaryAmount where getAmount() == this.getAmount().divide(amount, MathContext.DECIMAL128) and getCurrency() == this.getCurrency()

    • divide

      public BigDecimal divide(MonetaryAmount amount)
      Divide this by the given MonetaryAmount, which must have the same Currency as this.
      Returns:
      A BigDecimal that has a value this.getAmount().divide(amount, MathContext.DECIMAL128)

    • divide

      public MonetaryAmount divide(BigDecimal amount, MathContext mc)

      Returns:
      A MonetaryAmount where getAmount() == this.getAmount().divide(amount, mc) and getCurrency() == this.getCurrency()

    • divideToIntegralValue

      public BigDecimal divideToIntegralValue(MonetaryAmount divisor)
      java.math.BigDecimal analog method. Calculated as this.getAmount().divideToIntegralValue(divisor.getAmount()). The divisor must have the same currency as this.

    • signum

      public int signum()
      Returns the sign of this MonetaryAmount.
      Returns:
      -1, 0, or 1 as the value of this MonetaryAmount is negative, zero, or positive.

      fxRateMarket - market rate type.
      marketTime - effective market time.
      Returns:

      public MonetaryAmount convert(Currency toCurrency, FXRateMarket fxRateMarket, Date marketTime, Currency baseCurrency)
      Convert the current amount using the specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      toCurrency - target currency code.
      fxRateMarket - market rate type.
      marketTime - effective market time.
      baseCurrency - base currency.
      Returns:
      a new converted object.

    • setScaleToDefault

      public MonetaryAmount setScaleToDefault()
      Set scale using storage scale and default rounding mode.
      Returns:
      a new scaled object.

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(MonetaryAmount o)
      Compares this currency amount with another by comparing their numeric amounts. If both currency amounts specify a currency, then the currencies must be the same.

      See Comparable.compareTo(T) for an explanation of the int return value.

      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<MonetaryAmount>
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if both currency amounts specify a different non-null currency

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object o)
      Two CurrencyAmounts are considered equal if the currencies are the same and the amounts are equal.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Overrides:
      hashCode in class Object

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Converts tha currency amount to the form <amount>[<SPACE><currency>]. Note this routine does not apply localized formatting.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
